name: Corruption-Free Zone
title: Top Control of Corruption
description: In 2023, Norway achieved a perfect score in controlling corruption, ranking at the top globally with a 100 percentile rank.

name: Banking Bliss
title: Robust Financial Inclusion
description: By 2021, 100% of Norwegians aged 25+ and those with secondary education or more had accounts at financial institutions, showcasing exceptional financial inclusion.

name: Wealth Surge
title: Impressive GNI Per Capita Growth
description: In 2022, Norway's GNI per capita grew by an impressive 25.02%, highlighting significant economic prosperity.

name: Healthy Investment
title: High Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, Norway's government spent $7,447.64 per capita on health, with a PPP value of $8,505.55, reflecting a strong commitment to public health.

name: Clean Air Champions
title: Low Air Pollution Mortality
description: In 2019, Norway reported a low mortality rate of 9.4 per 100,000 males due to air pollution, indicating effective environmental policies.

name: Safe Motherhood
title: Minimal Maternal Mortality
description: With a maternal mortality ratio of just 1 per 100,000 live births in 2023, Norway stands out for its exceptional maternal health care.

name: Voice of the People
title: High Voice and Accountability
description: In 2023, Norway achieved a perfect 100 percentile rank in voice and accountability, reflecting a robust democratic environment.

name: Education Excellence
title: Near-Universal Primary Enrollment
description: In 2017, Norway had a primary school enrollment rate of 99.88%, demonstrating its commitment to education.

name: Trade Simplicity
title: Low Tariff Bound Rates
description: In 2021, Norway maintained low bound rates for all products at 2.83% and primary products at 0.56%, facilitating international trade.

name: Bottom 40% Prosperity
title: High Consumption for Lower Income
description: In 2022, the bottom 40% of Norway's population enjoyed a daily consumption of $49.42, indicating equitable wealth distribution.

name: Liquid Assets Alert
title: Moderate Bank Liquid Reserves
description: In 2023, Norway's bank liquid reserves to assets ratio stood at 69.60%, suggesting room for improvement in financial liquidity.
